title: Allow conversion from async client builder to blocking one
body:
The builders have mostly the same options and the blocking one is just a
wrapper around the async one. The possible conversion makes it easier to
support creating both kinds from configuration file, reducing some code
duplication.

My motivation is updating the spirit-reqwest configurator crate to 0.10 ‒ 0.9 had only one kind of client, now there are two and I'd like to be able to reuse the same code to create them.

Bumps [lodash](https://github.com/lodash/lodash) from 4.17.15 to 4.17.19.

title: deps(chore): update to the latest rustls
multipart for wasm32
body:
This PR introduces `Request::bearer_auth` for `wasm32` and multipart data based on [`FormData`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/FormData/Using_FormData_Objects)

I marked this as WIP as it is currently at proof of concept stage.

solves #965.

title: Issue #956: Take the cookie store write lock only when necessary
body:
This peeks at the first element of the iterator and hence prevents needing to take the write lock if there is no Set-Cookie in the response (which on nicely configured sites should be the majority of responses).

While the peekable() and peek() arguably add a slight performance penalty, it avoids needing to use synchronization primitives, which generally are more costly for threading / SMP on CPU cache lines.

Closes: #956

title: Add `blocking::Response::headers_mut`
body:
I noticed this method was missing. Not sure if its deliberate or not, but I would like to use it 😊

Let me know if there is changelog I need to update as well. CHANGELOG.md looked like it only contained released stuff.

title: Implement form() and query() for RequestBuilder [WASM]
body: Mostly the same as non-wasm implementation.

title: Error: add functions to check more error types.
body:
There are functions to check if the error is from an array of different
reasons, but there were no functions to check if the failure was due to
the rest of the possible error reasons. This commit adds though.

Fixes #942

title: Bump websocket-extensions from 0.1.3 to 0.1.4 in /examples/wasm_header
body:

title: Remove webpki-tokio from hyper-rustls
body:
`reqwest` doesn't actually care how hyper-rustls gets its root certs. By
not specifying any feature for hyper-rustls, `reqwest` is able to work
with `rusoto_core` and others better.

---

This fixes #933 (at least for my use cases) without reverting #862.

It's possible we need `features = ["tokio-runtime"]` but I'm not sure.

title: Backport Sentivite headers to blocking implementation
body: Back porting my previous PR into blocking implementation

title: Reject non-http, non-https URLs.
body:
Normally hyper is in charge of rejecting non-http URLs, but because
reqwest supports both http and https URLs, it calls enforce_http(false),
disabling hyper's checks.

This adds back a check in reqwest itself, plus a test.

There may still need to be an additional check in connect.rs.

Fixes #919

title: Rename option to “pool_max_idle_per_host”
body:
`reqwest` exposes the `pool_max_idle_per_host` option of `hyper`’s client builder. This option used to be called `max_idle_per_host` in the `hyper` crate, but [it has recently been renamed](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/pull/2142).

This patch renames the `reqwest` representation of this option to make it consistent with its name in the `hyper` crate again.

title: Define authorization headers as sensitive header
body:
Hello, Some headers are sensitive, as Authorization. Based in this fact, I defined a new function: ``` pub fn header_sensitive(mut self, key: K, value: V, sensitive: bool) -> RequestBuilder ``` I call it in these both functions, with `sensitive = true`: ``` pub fn basic_auth(self, username: U, password: Option

) -> RequestBuilder pub fn bearer_auth(self, token: T) -> RequestBuilder ``` And of course, I added 2 tests to validate my evolutions.

title: impl TryFrom http::Request
body:
issue: https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest/issues/883

impl From http::Request trait for blocking request

title: feat(proxy): Adds NO_PROXY environment variable support
body:
Adds support for loading from the `NO_PROXY` or `no_proxy` environment
variables. This should make reqwest support the system proxy settings.
Please note that I brought in one additional dependency in order to
handle CIDR blocks in the no proxy settings.

Closes #705

title: Make pool idle timeout configurable
body: `hyper`’s `ClientBuilder` has an option to define the idle timeout of the connection pool. As it’s quite useful to be able to modify this value, this patch extends reqwest’s `ClientBuilder` to expose that option as well. [The default value of 90 seconds is taken from `hyper`.](https://github.com/hyperium/hyper/blob/v0.13.4/src/client/mod.rs#L875)

title: Implement `Response::content_length` for `wasm32`
body:
I tried to implement `Response::content_length` for the Wasm target. Not sure if this is completely correct!

I'd like to also try to get `Response::chunk` working, but [it looks like we'll need to use a `ReadableStream`](https://rustwasm.github.io/wasm-bindgen/api/web_sys/struct.Response.html#method.body) and [I don't see how it's meant to be used](https://rustwasm.github.io/wasm-bindgen/api/web_sys/struct.ReadableStream.html).
